name: KBC Lottery Winner Scam
description: Scammer impersonates Kaun Banega Crorepati show claiming the victim's mobile number won a lottery prize, then demands processing fees via UPI or bank transfer to release the winnings.

turns.scammer_message: CONGRATULATIONS! Your mobile number has won Rs 25,00,000 in Kaun Banega Crorepati Season 15 Lucky Draw! Ref No: KBC-2026-IN-78901. Contact our office to claim your prize.
turns.notes: Initial bait message using KBC brand with a fake reference number for credibility.

turns.scammer_message: Dear winner, to process your prize of Rs 25,00,000, a one-time processing fee of Rs 5,500 is required as per RBI regulations. This covers tax clearance and prize verification. Please arrange the payment to claim your winnings.
turns.notes: Scammer introduces the processing fee using fake regulatory requirements.

turns.scammer_message: Please pay the processing fee of Rs 5,500 via UPI to kbc.prize@ybl for instant processing. For any assistance, contact KBC Prize Department head office at +91-9922334455. Your prize will be credited within 24 hours of payment confirmation.
turns.notes: Scammer reveals UPI ID and phone number for the fake prize department.

turns.scammer_message: If UPI is not available, you can transfer Rs 5,500 to our official KBC Prize Account: 5566339922887711 (State Bank of India, IFSC: SBIN0001234). Reference: KBC-2026-IN-78901. Payment must be completed today as per lottery commission guidelines.
turns.notes: Scammer provides bank account as alternative and adds urgency with commission guidelines.

turns.scammer_message: URGENT: Your KBC prize of Rs 25,00,000 will be FORFEITED if processing fee is not received by 8 PM today! Pay Rs 5,500 to kbc.prize@ybl or account 5566339922887711. Call +91-9922334455 NOW. This is your FINAL notice as per lottery commission rules!
turns.notes: Final urgency with threat of prize forfeiture, repeating all contact and payment details.
